definition[0]: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say
example[0]: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions.
example[1]: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
example[3]: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
example[4]: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=made it difficult for her to know what to do).
example[5]: She liked to dance but felt awkward if someone was watching her.
example[7]: Make sure that the baby is not sleeping in an awkward position.
definition[2]: difficult to do, use, or deal with
example[8]: It’ll be awkward getting cars in and out.
example[9]: The new financial arrangements were awkward to manage.
example[10]: A good carpenter can make a cupboard to fit the most awkward space.
example[11]: She was afraid he was going to ask an awkward question.
example[12]: I’m sorry to call at such an awkward time but I won’t keep you a minute.
definition[4]: an awkward person is deliberately unhelpful
example[13]: an awkward customer (=person who is difficult and unhelpful)
example[14]: The staff wanted to go home and they were getting awkward about a meeting starting so late.
